clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic/Pharmacodynamic Evaluation Amikacin in Critically Ill Patients Admitted at the Emergency Department
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetic/Pharmacodynamic (PK/PD) Evaluation of Amikacin in Patients With Severe Sepsis or Septic Shock Admitted at the Emergency Department(ED)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is the evaluation of PK/PD target attainment of amikacin in ED patients with severe sepsis and septic shock.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with amikacin PK/PD target attainment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome of this study was evaluation of PK/PD target attainment defined as amikacin peak concentration/Minimal Inhibitory Concentration > 8 in the 15 vs.25 mg/kg amikacin group in function of 1) actual MIC of isolated pathogens 2) breakpoints of European Committe on Antimicrobial susceptibility testing (EUCAST) of Enterobacteriaceae and Pseudomonas aeruginosa

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients admitted at the emergency department with a diagnosis of severe sepsis or septic shock in whom amikacin is indicatied
Exclusion Criteria:
- < 18 years
- pregnancy
- burns
- amikacin treatment in the previous 2 weeks
- known allergy to aminoglycosides
- Do Not Reanimate Code â‰¥ 2
- Hospitalized patients with a prolonged deep venous or arterial catheder
- Continuous renal replacement, intermittent hemodialysis and death within the time of start of amikacin replacement and 1 hour later
